subject: Education
title: Dual Coding: Words Plus Pictures
description: One-minute skill: Dual Coding: Words Plus Pictures.

hook.text: You remember 'a dog riding a skateboard' better than 'canine locomotion variant.' Why?

buildup.text: Allan Paivio's dual coding theory says verbal and visual information are stored separately.

discovery.text: Encoding the same idea in both words and images creates two retrieval paths instead of one.

twist.text: Simple drawings you make yourself work better than polished diagrams someone else made.

climax.text: Flashcards with images and words outperform text-only cards by up to 89%.

punchline.text: Two mental hooks are always better than one.

quiz.question: Why does dual coding improve memory?
options: It creates two retrieval paths by encoding in both verbal and visual formats
Pictures are always easier to understand than text
The brain prioritizes visual information over all others
